entry.title: How can I configure the Supply chain unit, Party entitled to dispose, Custodian to EWM warehouse?
entry.content:
How to find the right path in EWM Public Cloud for assigning Supply chain unit, Party entitled to dispose, Custodian to EWM warehouse number?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How can I configure the Supply chain unit, Party enti...
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

The assignment of SCU, Party Entitled to Dispose, Custodian to warehouse is done in SSCUI – 102657 (Set Warehouse Address).

The Party Entitled to Dispose can be configured directly in the SSCUI 102657 (Set Warehouse Address).

The Supply Chain Unit is created referred to: SCU_<WH No> with warehouse address (copied from plant address).

Unfortunately, the Custodian was not opened in the SSCUI for editing (different from On premises system). In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the 'Custodian' value will be always the same as the 'Party Entitled to Dispose'. To confirm this behavior, I tested it on my end. When a value is added to the 'Party Entitled to Dispose' field, the 'Custodian' field (in our internal tables) automatically adopts the same value. If the value is removed in the configuration 'Set Warehouse Address', the Custodian field is cleared as well. This linkage ensures no additional action is required on your part.

To configure the Set Warehouse Address in your system, please check the setup guide:

 S4H_588 Warehouse Management Setup.

Best regards,

Geovana

entry.title: Mass deletion of MARD entries for a specific storage location without affecting MARC/MARA
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m currently facing the following challenge and would appreciate any advice from the community:

We want to delete a specific storage location (e.g., an external warehouse) from the material master storage location data (MARD) — for all affected materials (~300,000) — without touching any entries in MARC or MARA.

Goal:
Only remove the MARD entries for this storage location – essentially, delete the storage location view from the material master.

Conditions:

  • The same material can exist in multiple storage locations, but only the specified one should be deleted

  • The external storage location is no longer used

  • This should be done per storage location, not per material

My questions:

  1. Has anyone used MM17 for this kind of mass deletion?

  2. Are there any limitations in using MM17 for deleting storage location views in MARD?

  3. Are there alternatives?

  4. Is it supported/safe to delete MARD records directly via standard tools, or is it considered risky?

Any feedback or shared experience would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance and best regards,

K. Xhyra

Greetings,

I think the sceanrio which you are describing should work to some extent. Please see below a screen shot of two inspection lots for same material but differenzt vendors:

In the inspection plan I have maintained the following assignemnt to vendor:

I think  your case is not functioaning due to wrong usage of MPN materials. You have described "We have a Material with MPN maintained but being procured from two different vendors but from the same Manufacturer." and if you read the documentation reagrding MPN profiles it is written "Manufacturer will then be applied as a further criterion for dynamization purposes and in the selection of the inspection plan."

I would say that you need to rethink why you are using MPN profiles if the manufacturer is the same and think about a scenario without MPN profile - such scernarios should function but be aware if you are using S4 HANA see note 3467807 !

Best regards, M.

entry.title: Customer Checkout cloud edition - Integration Suite
entry.content:
This blog post describes how use SAP Customer Checkout, cloud edition with SAP Integration Suite.

Prerequisite:

  • Client id and client secret for SAP Customer Checkout, cloud edition
  • Access to SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition
  • Access to SAP Integration Suite

Check out this guide how to create client id and client secret
https://community.sap.com/t5/crm-and-cx-blog-posts-by-sap/customer-checkout-cloud-edition-create-technical-user/ba-p/14174481 

Integration Suite Example

1. Start in Integration Suite - Click on Integration and APIs


2. Click on "Security Material"

3. Click on "Create" -> "OAuth 2 Client Credentials"

4. Create new OAuth 2 Client Credentials

 

Field nameExample valueSource of the value
Token Service URLhttps://******.accounts.ondemand.com/oauth2/tokenCCOm, cloud edition
Configuration -> About 
OAuth 2.0 Token endpoint
Client AuthenticationSend as Body Parameter 
Content Typeapplication/x-www-form-urlencoded 
Custom parameterssee below 

Custom parameters

resource urn:sap:identity:application:provider:name:ccom

The last part "ccom" must match with the dependency name specified in SAP Cloud Identity Services

5. Click on "Integrations and APIs". Click on "Create" and create new design

6. Click on "Add" and create a new "Integration Flow". Click on the newly created "Integration Flow"

7. Create a "Timer" 

 

8. Configure "Timer" that integration flow is started on deployment

9. Add "Request Reply" to workflow

10. Connect "Timer" to "Request Reply / Ping-Request"

11. Create a Receiver

12. Connect the "Ping request" to "Receiver"

13. Configure HTTP-Call to Receiver with API URL of SAP Customer Checkout manager, cloud edition

 

Addresshttps://***-api.customercheckout.cloud.sap/api/external/v1/ping
MethodGET
AuthenticationOAuth 2 Client Credentials
Credential Name(Step below)


14. Create Groovy Script to parse the result and attach the result to the workflow run

Click on "Processing" and "Select"

Upload the following file as "storeResult.groovy"

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;
import groovy.json.JsonSlurper;

def Message processData(Message message) {
    def body = message.getBody(java.lang.String)
    def messageLog = messageLogFactory.getMessageLog(message)
    if (messageLog != null) {
        messageLog.addAttachmentAsString('PingResponse', body, 'text/plain')
    }

    return message;
}

15. Connect Ping-Request to Script and Script to End

16. Click on "Save" and Click on "Deploy"

17. Integration Flow was started

18. Click on "Integrations and APIs" and "All Artifacts"

19. Verify that your test worked well. Click on "Ping-Response" Attachment to verify the result

20. Verify the result

entry.title: Introducing Forms for Cases - SAP Sales & Service Cloud v2 + ESM
entry.content:
Using forms to capture information about cases and trigger workflows based on form contents. You can also use forms to post information to external systems.

You, as an administrator, can create custom forms and versions for case data entry. If you've enabled forms for a specific case type, you can find the Forms tab on the case detail view. Use conditions to make specific form fields required, read only, or hidden.

Control Palette

Form includes a drag and drop into form designer where you can add text, entry fields, and other controls like check boxes and radio buttons to your form. Each field or control can also include conditions to show or hide the control based on previous data entry. In addition, you can use rules to automatically assign the most appropriate forms to a specific case type.

Text Inputs

  • Text — A single-line text field. This is the default value for an input element.
  • Heading — A single-line text field. This is the display in Level 1 or 2
  • Paragraph — A single-line text field. 
  • Textarea — A multi-line text field.
  • Link — A field for entering a URL. The browser may provide validation to ensure the text is in a valid URL format.

Numeric Inputs

  • Number — A field for entering a number.

Selection Inputs

  • Radio Buttons — A radio button that allows the user to select only one option from a group of choices.
  • Checkbox Group — A checkbox that allows the user to enable or disable.
  • Checkbox — A checkbox that allows the user to enable or disable.
  • Dropdown — A dropdown list that allows the user to select.

 Table Inputs

Each column of the table can be of one of these types (with their corresponding properties):

  • Text
  • Checkbox
  • Number
  • Date
  • Dropdown Menu

 Date and Time Inputs

  • Date — A control for entering a date (year, month, and day).
  • time — A control for entering a time (hour and minute).
  • datetime-local — A control for entering both a date and time, without time zone information.
  • month — A control for entering a month and year.
  • week — A control for entering a week and year.

 Not yet Supported.

  • Password — A single-line text field where the input is obscured to protect sensitive information.
  • Email — A field specifically for entering one or more email addresses. Validation ensures that the text entered is a valid e-mail address.
  • Search — A single-line text field for entering search queries. It may include a control to clear the entered text.
  • Tel — A field for entering a telephone number. Unlike email, it doesn’t enforce a specific syntax, but it may trigger a numeric keypad on mobile devices.

Form Integration

Create an outbound configuration to enable form buttons to send or retrieve data from external systems and to populate values in dropdown menus, radio buttons, and checkbox groups based on a dynamic data source.

Set up an outbound communication system under Settings  > Integration  > Communication Systems.

Pre-requisities

  • SAP Integration Suite or Cloud Integration (CPI) with Custom Iflow Deployed
  • Set up an outbound configuration under form integration for the API call.

Context

Values displayed in dropdown menus, radio buttons, and checkbox groups are populated by making API calls to external systems through SAP Cloud Integration CPI or Integration Suite.

Configure Dynamic Data Source

Set API URLs to populate values in dropdown menus, radio buttons, and checkbox groups based on a dynamic data source.
  1. Go to your profile menu and choose Settings  Forms.
  2. Select a form from the list and select Open Form Builder for the version you want to edit.
  3. Select the form control to use a dynamic data source to populate values.

  1. In the Data Source area, choose Dynamic and then select the globe icon () to open the iFlow Configuration screen.
  2. Select the applicable HTTP data from the outbound configuration that was configured in the Form Integration section.
  3. Select data that you want to send with the API as the iFlow Input. Choose from case, user, or form fields.

    Select Download Request JSON Schema to download the request schema as a file in a JSON format. Upload this file in SAP Cloud Integration while creating message mapping for the API request.

  4. Select Download Response JSON Schema to download the response schema as a file in a JSON format. Upload this file in SAP Cloud Integration when creating message mapping for the API response.
  5. Save the iFlow Configuration.

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud: Introduction and Deep Dive!
entry.content:
Hello SAP Colleagues, 

Hope you all are doing well and are safe wherever you are.

Welcome back to another blog post. In this blog post, we are going to discuss SAP Business Data

Cloud: Introduction and will deep dive into it to understand it better. I expect you have gone through my previous blogs on SAP Datasphere, SAP HANA XSA, SAC, BTP, SAP CAI, and BW4HANA 2.0, and they might have been useful for you.

So let us start and get set to go!

SAP Business Data Cloud was launched on February 13, 2025, during the SAP Business Unleashed virtual event and is currently available on a controlled basis, with full general availability (GA) planned for April 2025. This new solution integrates SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and BW capabilities, providing a trusted data foundation for AI and analytics by unifying SAP and third-party data.

Data Unification:
It unifies all SAP and third-party data to create a trusted, comprehensive data foundation for AI and analytics.
Integration with SAP Technologies:
It integrates existing SAP offerings like SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and BW capabilities.
Agentic AI Focus:
Designed to provide the necessary data foundation for agentic AI applications, including SAP's Joule AI copilot.
Partnership with Databricks:
It includes significant enhancements through a partnership with Databricks to integrate their data and AI platform. 

  • This partnership enables customers to integrate SAP data with the rest of the enterprise data for advanced analytics and AI use cases, including agent systems.
  • SAP Databricks will be a native component in the SAP Business Data Cloud.
  • SAP Databricks enables customers to bidirectionally share data between SAP Databricks and their enterprise environment while ensuring SAP data retains all of its semantics.

In short, it is the marriage between the most important business data for enterprises globally (SAP data) and the best data platform in the market (Databricks). Our new offering, SAP Databricks, is sold by SAP as part of SAP Business Data Cloud on Azure, AWS, and GCP. SAP Databricks provides customers artificial intelligence, data warehousing, and data engineering capabilities, all governed by Unity Catalog.

In the past years, Databricks has expanded its portfolio of products to cover more and more of the data and AI space, ranging from data engineering, data warehousing, governance, business intelligence, and AI. Every time we announced one of these expansions to our customers, we would get the question from the audience, "What about SAP data? Do you have any plans for that?" and we would see many nodding faces in the audience. This is because SAP data—which powers ERP for business planning, Ariba for procurement, SuccessFactors for HR, and Concur for travel management—is essential for the 90% of Fortune 500 organizations leveraging SAP. Using that essential data with modern data platforms outside SAP has been daunting and hard.

This is why we think this partnership will have a big impact on our customer base. SAP Databricks will have all the relevant datasets enriched and ready to be used for everything from data warehousing to building AI that can reason on that data. We call the latter data intelligence, i.e., not just general intelligence, but intelligence that can reason on this essential business data.

Now let us see this diagram, which gives a clear illustration of the partnership and way forward.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Now let us deep dive into SAP Business data cloud i.,e, SAP BDC.

AP Business Data Cloud is a fully managed SaaS solution that unifies and governs all SAP data and seamlessly connects with third-party data, giving line of business leaders context to make even more impactful decisions. It combines all the powerful functionality of SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Business Warehouse, plus managed SAP Databricks and Intelligent Application, including data products for SAP line of business applications.

So in Short we can say SAP BDC stands for   B : BW4HANA D : Datasphere C: Cloud Analytics using SAP analytics cloud.

Key Features of SAP Business Data Cloud

  • Insight Apps: Pre-built SAP content, including Datasphere models and SAC story visualizations, managed by SAP.
  • Foundation Services & Data Products: SAP delivers operational data as reusable packages for business scenarios.
  • Role of Datasphere & SAC: Datasphere acts as a semantic layer, while SAC provides visualization for Insight Apps.
  • BW to BDC Migration: Hybrid migration paths exist for BW customers using BW/4HANA PCE.
  • Databricks & Delta Sharing: SAP enables zero-copy delta sharing, allowing ML notebooks within the SAP environment.

SAP Business Data Cloud differentiates from other data and analytics solutions by offering:

  • Prebuilt insight applications for advanced analytics and planning across all lines of business to deliver transformational insights.

  • Access to curated, SAP managed data products across your most important business processes, keeping its business context and semantics intact and fully governed.

  • Harmonization of all your SAP and third-party data with fully managed capabilities for a business data fabric architecture, business warehouse modernization, planning, data engineering and AI/ML.

  • SAP Databricks for pro-code development of AI, machine learning, and data engineering tasks.

Now let us get into the SaaS solution and understand the components 1 by 1.

SAP BDC URL :  Home - SAP Business Data Cloud

When we log into SAP BDC, the trial version looks as above.

But when we get the licensed version, it has a few other apps, which are shown below.

The first thing is intelligent applications and data packages.

  • Accenture will release six intelligent applications addressing key challenges in supply chain, talent, finance, and procurement (GA timeline pending). 
  • Adobe and SAP are co-developing an application that fuses Adobe’s marketing data with SAP’s financial and supply chain data, enabling real-time alignment between demand signals and operational planning, expected in late 2025. 
  • Palantir and SAP are partnering to facilitate joint customers’ cloud migration journey and modernization programs. Seamless connectivity between Palantir and SAP Business Data Cloud will enable customers to build a harmonized data foundation across their enterprise landscape. SAP Business Data Cloud and Palantir Foundry and AIP will transform data silos into a trusted data foundation that enables human + AI teaming in the real world. Together the companies will responsibly deliver essential outcomes and support customers, including the U.S. government, to quickly adapt to changes and disruptions.
  • Thomson Reuters will develop an intelligent application to help customers navigate the fast-moving challenges in the current global trade and tariffs environment, planned for end of 2025.
  • Joint Collibra and SAP Business Data Cloud customers can now run up to 10x more active data quality jobs in Collibra Data Quality & Observability when run on SAP BDC data, at no additional cost. This limited time offer helps accelerate decision-making, strengthen compliance, and improve AI readiness and is available until May 30, 2026.

Now let us deep dive into 1 of the intelligent applications and it's details.

As we can see In the installed tab, you can view all the installed intelligent applications and data packages.

Select the Installed tab, then the Working Capital Insights Intelligent Application.

The above picture illustrates detailed information about the intelligent applications and data products.

Page down to Content.

This section contains information on the dedicated file repository in SAP Analytics Cloud and SAP-managed spaces in SAP Datasphere.

  • SAP Analytics Cloud: The stories that are comprised in this Intelligent Application will be created in a folder called SAP_SAC_WCI. You can find this under the Files -> Insight Apps -> SAP S/4HANA -> Finance tab. This folder is SAP-managed and will be read-only.

  • SAP Datasphere: The installation creates and deploys three spaces in the underlying SAP Datasphere. The spaces are SAP-managed, and cannot be edited.

    • SAP_WCI - This space contains all the analytic models that form the foundation of the SAP Analytics Cloud stories.
    • SAP_S4H - This space contains all the modeling artifacts required to build the analytic models, such as views, data access controls etc.
    • SAP_S4H_ING - This space contains all the local tables and their corresponding replication flows. The data from the data products reside in these local tables.

Please see the below image for the same.

Now let us see where is the SAP Databricks component is there where we can create AI/ML models and Notebook etc.

Click on the SAP Databricks instance. 

Now let us create a sample query : 

Role of Databricks in BDC

AP Databricks within BDC offers limited functionality, focusing on:

  • Zero-copy delta sharing for Data Products.
  • ML notebook execution within SAP’s ecosystem.

Integration with Joule AI Agents

BDC enables Joule AI agents by grounding them in business context via knowledge graph-powered data models.

BDC Pricing Model

BDC pricing is based on Capacity Units (CUs). Minimum capacity units is 966.

  • SAC Public Cloud Edition (PCE) will be moved out of CPEA/BTPEA license and will move from user-based licenses to capacity units-based pricing. Minimum BDC capacity units will equate to a SAC Public tenant capacity units (966) of 25 BI user licenses. Standalone SAC SKUs will gradually be offset as BDC data centers and migration tools become available in H2 2025 and beyond.
  • Insight Apps are priced based on source system Full-User Equivalents (FUEs).
  • Datasphere & BW PCE remain capacity-based.
  • SAP Databricks follows CU pricing.
SAP BDC ComponentCurrent LicensePost-BDC License
DataspherePay as you GoDeprecated
 CPEA/BTPEADeprecated
 SubscriptionEvolves into BDC
SAC Public Cloud EditionCPEA/BTPEADeprecated
 SubscriptionEvolves into BDC
SAP BWSubscriptionEvolves into BDC

BDC is not bundled with SAP RISE, and no roadmap exists to do so. Existing customers can continue using their current licensing model until renewal, after which restructuring may be required.

Conclusion

SAP Business Data Cloud aims to unify SAP ERP, big data, and analytics. Its integration with Datasphere, SAC, and Databricks provides a comprehensive data solution, though challenges remain in ensuring seamless single-sign-on and end-to-end authorizations. Time will determine how well these integrations deliver value to businesses globally.

I will create a E2E scenario on SAP BDC and consuming the data products in SAP data bricks to create a business case scenario.

Thank you for reading.

Regards,

Narasingha Patro

entry.title: Re: Assign Storage bin to PSA for multiple products in Mass
entry.content:
• For SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 this feature Migration object for the SAP Fiori app “Assign Bin to PSA” is available.

Bin assignment to production supply area 

  • For SAP S/4HANA On-Premise an option is to enter PSASTAGE values in one source system and later during project (DEV, QA, PROD) copy data from source system via SAP Menu > Utilities > Adjustment 

Detailed Steps:
- log on to your customer client
- start the IMG-activity, where you miss data
- navigate over the menu Utilities -> Adjustment
- chose the remote connection which points to copy client 
- choose the entries which you want to adjust
- press button 'Adjust'
- press button 'Entry' or 'Field' or 'All'
- go back with the green Arrow for two times
- confirm the question
Data has been changed by adjustment
Copy changes?
with Yes

If you have no system connection which points to copy client than you need to create this connection within transaction SM59.

entry.title: Re: Access CDS Objects Exposed as SQL Services Using Microsoft SQL Server
entry.content:
Hi Roberto,
yes, very strange. I also do not understand what goes wrong here since the query assembled by MS SQL should not have any parameter markers.

To make the SQL query that causes the problem visible I need a trace. 
Could you please set a "Path to Tracefile" and "Trace" = "debug" in the ODBC tool.
After this the ODBC driver for ABAP should start to write trace files into the configured path for new connections.
After you reproduced the problem we should have a trace file containing the problematic SQL statement string.
Don't forget to reset "Trace" to "none" afterwards.

If you can provide such a trace we should be able to get a better feeling if the problem is on our side or in MS SQL server side and I can try to involve the appropriate experts.
Regards
                   Frank

entry.title: Sales Contract Shows "Completed" Before Delivery or Billing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
We observed that a Sales Contract in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition displays a status of “Completed” immediately after a follow-on Sales Order is created — even though no delivery or billing has yet occurred.

This raised a few questions:

  • Why does the contract show as Completed before delivery or billing?
  • Is this standard system behavior?
  • Can we control or delay when a contract is marked “Completed”?

Looking for clarification and best practices in public cloud environments. Thank you!


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Setup Guide

I also synced all the roles and business catalogs to SAP BWZ and still getting the same response from Joule.

entry.title: Re: Sales Contract Shows "Completed" Before Delivery or B...
entry.content:
Yes, this is standard behavior in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and it is controlled by the Completion Rule assigned to the item category used in the contract.

Why It Happens?

  • Sales Contracts are marked “Completed” when their target quantity or value is fully referenced by follow-on documents (such as Sales Orders).
  • This completion happens regardless of whether delivery or billing has taken place.
  • It is driven by the Completion Rule, which is typically set to “C” (complete once fully referenced).

Can This Be Changed?

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, this field:

  • Is not exposed in SSCUI 102628 (Configure Item Categories),
  • And cannot be changed directly by the customer.

This means customers cannot modify the Completion Rule themselves via app or SSCUI.

entry.title: Re: Usage of Expand Entity in OData Service Consumption Model
entry.content:
Thank you @alrikx for the clear explanation and post!

Another hint for those who want to use OData Consumption Model with nested expand, for example, A_OutboundDelivery/TO_DELIVERY_DOCUMENT_ITEM/TO_HANDLING_UNIT_ITEM_DELI

You can achieve it using the return  of the the add_expand method

DATA(lr_expand_root) = lr_request->create_expand_node( ).
DATA(lr_document_item_expand) = lr_expand_root->add_expand( 'TO_DELIVERY_DOCUMENT_ITEM' ).
lr_document_item_expand->add_expand( 'TO_HANDLING_UNIT_ITEM_DELI' ).

Be aware to follow @alrikx tips in the same way to make the get_business_data to work (create an internal table type inside of the item in this example with the name TO_HANDLING_UNIT_ITEM_DELI)


For more details, read the documentation of Interface /iwbep/if_cp_expand_node->add_expand method

entry.title: Re: Contol records for actual ccs missing for valuation a...
entry.content:
When you kick off Material Ledger Actual Costing but don’t finish the startup (via FCML4H_STARTUP or CKMSTART), SAP writes a “pending startup” flag that’s scoped to your user ID and the valuation area. That flag does two things:

  1. Blocks material-master changes in the Accounting 1 view As soon as the flag is set, any attempt by the flagged user to edit or save fields in the Accounting 1 view of the material master will trigger an error (“valuation area XXX not yet productive with Material Ledger”).
  2. Prevents Material Ledger postings and runs for that user Until that same user completes the startup run, any goods‐movement postings, invoice verifications or costing runs (CKM*, CKML reports, etc.) that need the Ledger will also be blocked with the same “not yet productive” message.

Because the flag is tied to the user who initiated the incomplete startup, other users—who haven’t triggered that flag—can continue to change their material masters and post transactions normally.

Have the same user re‐run the full startup sequence (CKMSTART or FCML4H_STARTUP) and let it finish without errors.

If the user cannot complete the startup, a Basis consultant can remove the flag (table CKMLHEAD, field OWNER) manually—though SAP strongly recommends running the proper startup instead.

Check consistency of your valuation areas (all currencies, cost component splits) before startup. Review SAP Note 2699241 for full “productive” activation steps. If you hit MLCCS102 or related errors, ensure your Cost Component Structure is identical across currencies before re‐running.

entry.title: Re: SAP S4/Hana Cloud Public, define validation rules: co...
entry.content:
Hi @rekafulop 

Thank you for sharing the details

Based on the notes and the attached screenshot, your error contains contra node 1022510/10" indicates an issue with the contra node configuration in your GL hierarchy. I believe the issue you are facing stems from the use of the G/L hierarchy node 0ASSETS, which includes a contra node (1022510/10). SAP does not support contra accounts in validation rule hierarchies.

Please note, the following are common issues related to that:

  • The contra node "1022510/10" may be incorrectly assigned under "0ASSETS" or contains GL accounts directly, which is not supported.
  • The "Allow Contra Items" flag in your hierarchy settings might be missing or misconfigured.
  • The hierarchy node relationships might not align with SAP's expected structure for contra accounts.

I recommend reviewing your GL hierarchy in the Manage Global Hierarchies app, checking the contra node settings, and ensuring that contra nodes are configured properly without direct GL account assignments that violate hierarchy rules.

Here are possible steps you can take:

  • Firstly, create a custom hierarchy node excluding contra accounts (e.g. ZASSETS) and use it in the validation rule.
  • Then, manually select valid G/L accounts or ranges in the rule instead of using the 0ASSETS node.

If the contra node causes issues, as mentioned earlier consider adjusting or removing it temporarily to isolate the problem. The following links can also be of help.

3303329 - Manage Global Hierarchies app raises error "The hierarchy ID and node ID cannot exceed a total of 14 characters"

Manage your hierarchies in FIORI

3569200 - FSV cannot be selected in "Balance Sheet/Income Statement - Multidimensional" app - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: The non-valuation of inter-projects and intra-projects stock transfers PUBLIC CLOUD
entry.content:
Subject: Inconsistent Valuation on Project-to-Project Stock Transfers (Mvt Type 344 Q and Mvt Type 343 Q)  

Dear SAP Experts, 

We are facing a critical issue with project-to-project stock transfers where the accounting posting for the stock valuation is inconsistent. Sometimes the transfer correctly generates a financial document, and other times it does not, despite using the exact same procedure. 

Business Process: 
We perform stock transfers of valuated project stock (Q-stock) between two different WBS Elements belonging to different projects. 

Applications : Transfer Stock Cross-Plant, Transfer Stock In Plant 

Movement Type: 344,343 (Special Stock Q) 

Problem Description: 

The expected behavior for a transfer posting with movement type 344 Q is the creation of both a Material Document for the quantity transfer and a corresponding Accounting Document for the value transfer. 

However, the system is failing to perform the value transfer. It only executes the physical quantity movement, leading to a critical data inconsistency: 

Receiving Project: The stock quantity is correctly increased, but it is received with zero value. 

Sending Project: The stock quantity is correctly reduced (often to zero), but it improperly retains the full inventory value. 

This results in a severe mismatch where the sending project has a monetary value with no associated stock, and the receiving project has stock with no value, corrupting our project cost and inventory reporting. 

We have been unable to identify a pattern or reason for this inconsistency. It occurs with the same material type, same movement type, and between similar project structures.

entry.title: Kicking Off LangGraph Agents 🦜 🔗 from SAP Joule Studio 💎 💻
entry.content:
1 – Why this matters 💪

Until now, Joule conversations were mostly synchronous: the copilot fetched data, reasoned, and replied in one go. But many business processes need long-running, multi-step logic (think document routing, complex approvals, or data harmonisation) that should continue well after the user closes the chat.

Thanks to the July 2025 Joule Studio update, a Skill can now hit any HTTP endpoint configured as a Destination. If that endpoint points to a Flask app wrapping a LangGraph agent, Joule can fire off the request and immediately return control to the user. The LangGraph agent then runs independently, using:

  • SAP BTP AI Core for scalable LLM calls or fine-tuned models

  • SAP Integration Suite for robust connectivity to SAP and non-SAP back ends

  • Whatever graph logic you design: retries, memory, parallel tools, you name it

The result is a loosely coupled pattern: Joule handles the conversational UX; LangGraph handles the orchestration; BTP services supply compute and integrations.

 

2 – How the plumbing works 🔗

  1. Package your LangGraph agent as a Flask server

    Inside the POST /invoke handler, accept JSON from Joule, run the graph, and return 202 Accepted. Optionally persist a  correlation ID.

  2. Deploy to SAP BTP (Kyma / Cloud Foundry)

    Expose the route only internally.

  3. Create a Destination

    In your BTP sub-account set ProxyType = Internet (Kyma) or OnPremise (Cloud Connector) and enable WebIDEEnabled.

  4. Add a Joule Skill

    In Joule Studio ➔ Data Services, import the OpenAPI spec (or point to the /openapi.json of your Flask app) and map inputs/outputs.

  5. Call it from chat

    When the user says “Launch quarterly risk analysis”, Joule issues a POST, gets a 202, and replies: “Sure, I’ve launched the analysis. I’ll notify you when it’s done.”

 

3 – What this unlocks in France or Belgium 💼

Automated PDF contract review for a Belgian insurer

User: « Analyse ce contrat RC Auto et signale les clauses à risque »

Flow: Joule uploads the PDF ➔ triggers LangGraph ➔ agent calls AI Core for document parsing and legal-clause LLM prompts ➔ Integration Suite writes findings back to S/4HANA CM. A Teams message notifies the underwriter when the report is ready.

Regulatory e-invoicing enrichment for French retailers

User: « Prépare la facture X-France pour Carrefour »

Flow: Joule fires a LangGraph agent that enriches raw FI data with mandatory e-invoicing fields, queries external tax APIs, validates against Chorus Pro requirements, and pushes the XML to Integration Suite for submission. All without blocking the chat.

Smart maintenance work-package builder for a Benelux chemical plant

User: « Planifie la révision du compresseur C-450 »

Flow: Joule triggers a LangGraph graph that checks equipment history, predicts spare-part demand via an ML model in AI Core, reserves materials in S/4HANA, schedules technicians in Field Service Management, and emails a consolidated work order PDF.

 

4 – Getting started in your landscape ✅

  1. Clone the LangGraph Flask boilerplate (SAP Sample GitHub repo).

git clone https://github.com/langchain-ai/new-langgraph-project my_agent
cd my_agent && pip install -e .

 

This gives you the default folder layout with src/agent/graph.py.

  • Add your graph logic

    Implement the state machine, tools, and memory inside src/agent/graph.py exactly as you would for any LangGraph project.

  • Wrap it in a Flask service

    Create an app.py at the project root:

from flask import Flask, request
from src.agent.graph import app as graph  # compiled LangGraph app

flask_app = Flask(__name__)

@flask_app.post("/invoke")
def invoke():
    payload = request.get_json(force=True)
    run_id = graph.invoke_async(payload)  # non-blocking
    return ("", 202, {"X-Run-ID": run_id})​

      4. Tell LangGraph to use Flask

      Edit langgraph.json:

{
  "graphs": { "agent": "./src/agent/graph.py:graph" },
  "http":   { "app": "./app.py:flask_app" }
}

  1. Containerize and push to SAP BTP

    • Cloud Foundry: cf push my-agent

    • Kyma: build an OCI image and kubectl apply -f deployment.yaml

     

  2. Create a Destination

    In your BTP sub-account, set Type = HTTP, choose OAuth2 Client Credentials (or principal propagation through Cloud Connector), and point the URL to /invoke.

  3. Import the endpoint as a Joule Skill

    In Joule Studio → Data Services → Import from Destination, load the OpenAPI spec or manually define the POST request.

  4. Chat, trigger and iterate

    Ask Joule: “Lance l’analyse de risque trimestrielle.” Joule calls the /invoke route, gets a 202 response, and immediately tells the user the job has started. Use notifications (Teams, e-mail, SAP Mobile Start) to report completion.

You now have a fully decoupled “fire-and-forget” pattern: Joule for conversation, LangGraph for orchestration, AI Core for heavy LLM calls, and Integration Suite for back-end connectivity, all glued together by a single Destination.

 

5 – Why this is a big deal 🎯

  • Decouple UX from heavy workflows - users get instant confirmation; complex logic runs in the background.

  • Reuse BTP services you already own - AI Core, Integration Suite, Event Mesh, CAP apps.

  • Lean path to innovation for hybrid customers - no need to upgrade core ERP before piloting AI-powered assistants.

  • Future-proof architecture - swap the Flask server with any containerized runtime; switch models in AI Core; extend graphs without touching Joule.

 

Early pilots show cycle-time reductions of 40 % on multi-step tasks, with minimal change management, because users just chat!

Ready to let Joule pull LangGraph’s trigger?
Your first “fire-and-forget” Skill is only a Flask endpoint away. 🚀

entry.title: Presença no SAP Inside Track SP 2025 ( SITSP2025)
entry.content:
Os curadores da comunidade SAP do RJ ( @Leo_coelho76, @michellemachado e @EduardoPalafoz ),  participaram dos eventos realizados em São Paulo, que foi realizado em 26/07/2025 .

O evento teve seu inicio na sexta feira com o Code Jam, onde Michelle assistiu a apresentação conduzida pelo Josh barba azul ( josh_bentley), em paralelo fui ajudar os curadores de SP ( @RobertaFernande) na preparação de alguns pontos.

No sábado, Leonardo, Michelle e Eu, comparecemos no evento. Leo e Eu fizemos parte da equipe voluntária, registrando o momento com fotos. Já Michelle, foi obter mais conhecimento técnico com o sitdev.

Foi um sábado com uma variedade de conteúdo para funcionais, como reforma tributária entre outros temas e para Dev, btp e etc. Acredito que teve um publico de 400 pessoas e posso garantir, foi sensacional.

 

O SAP Inside track é um evento focado para Comunidade SAP, onde acontece o compartilhamento de conhecimento entre palestrantes e Consultores SAP.

É um evento que vejo uma boa forma de networking entre as pessoas e, uma coisa que sempre enfatizo é que os palestrantes 'Deuses' que vemos no LinkedIn ou em webinar, são simples mortais onde qualquer pessoa pode acessá-los para conversar, tirar dúvidas, fotos e curiosidades e eles sempre são bem acessíveis.

Desta forma, a comunidade do Rio de Janeiro pretende fazer mais eventos para networking.

SAP Community 

SAP Inside Track

entry.title: SAP Service Cloud V2 Utilities Add-on - Extending Utility Premise Object -> PART II
entry.content:
Introduction

As part of the process to extend the data replication of Premise with a custom field, this blog focus on the step to add this field to the Premise object in SAP Service Cloud V2 and then through adaption have the field visible on the Premise view.

This is part II of 3 blogs covering the steps to achieve this.

Part I - SAP Service Cloud V2 Utilities Add-on - Extending Premise Replication with Custom Field

Part II - This blog

Part III - Update Mapping in SAP Data Integration Suite (still to come)

 

Adding field to Premise Object

Under settings in SAP Service Cloud V2, select ‘Extensibility Administration’ and find the Premise object.

 

 

Then click the ‘+’ sign to add a field.

Fill in the required fields. The technical name is important for us later, as this is what we to refer to when creating the mapping between the field send from SAP S/4HANA and this field.

 

 

Verify that API contains the added attribute

We can also check if the field is available now, by calling the service using a tool like Postman or Bruno. In addition to the URL, the call must be configured to use authentication, e.g. user and password if Basic Authentication is used.

Replace '{tenantID}' with your tenant id.

https://{tenantID}/sap/c4c/api/v1/repository-service/openApiSchemas/sap.crm.premiseservice.api.premiseS4ReplicationIn

Even without any custom extension, there is a structure reserved for these under 'extensions'. At the bottom of the response, you will the field just defined in SAP Service Cloud V2.

 

 

With the above defined, SAP Service Cloud V2, will accept the custom field when mapped to the extension structure.

 

Use Adaptation to add the custom field to the Premise View

In order for the field to be visible for a user, we add this to the Premise view, using adaptation.

The plan is to place this field in the 'Details' section. Selecting the '+' sign and the 'pencil' provides access to all fields that be configured for this section. This is both for standard delivered fields and custom fields.

Select 'Add from List' and then 'Extensions' - this is where all custom extended fields will be visible.

On the list we have 'Roof Type'

Select this using the '+' sign and then select 'Apply'. The field is now available on the view:

This completes the steps needed for SAP Service Cloud V2.

In the next blog we will take the final step to create a mapping between the field send from SAP S/4HANA and the receiving field in SAP Service Cloud V2.

entry.title: Escalation Email for Pending Approvals in SAP Business ByDesign
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

My company is currently working with SAP Business ByDesign, and I have a question regarding approval workflows.

Is there a way to set up an automatic escalation email if a Purchase Order or Invoice approval has not been completed within a certain time frame (e.g., 3 days)? Ideally, I would like the system to:

  • Notify the requester that the approval is overdue

  • Trigger an escalation email to a superior or next-level approver if no action has been taken

Questions:

entry.title: Re: The non-valuation of inter-projects and intra-project...
entry.content:
You’re using movement type 344 Q (and its reverse 343 Q) to move valuated Q-stock between WBS elements and sometimes only the material document is posted—no FI document. That leaves sending projects holding value with zero stock and receiving ones holding stock with zero value.

Movement type 344 Q is the reversal of 343 Q (goods issue from one project to another).  A correctly configured 344 Q should post a material document and an accounting document that debits the receiving WBS and credits the sending WBS at the stock valuation price.

The standard FI posting logic is whenever you post a cross-project transfer of valuated stock, SAP generates:

  • A material document for quantity movement
  • A parallel accounting document valuing the movement at the issuing stock’s valuation price

If the accounting document is missing, the root cause is most often in customizing or update failures, not a normal system behavior.

Potential root causes are

The “GL update” indicator may be disabled for 344 Q. Check in SPRO under Materials Management → Inventory Management → Movement Types → Copy, Change Movement Types that 344 Q is set to trigger real‐time accounting.

In OBYC, ensure your transaction keys for Q-stock use the proper valuation class and G/L accounts. A missing or wrong entry can silently skip FI.

Validate in SPRO → Project System → Integration with Other Components → Materials Management that Q-stock transfers to other WBS always post to CO and FI.

Use SM13 to check for failed update requests. Look in SM21 for dump entries immediately after your inconsistent postings.

If you run ML, cross-plant or cross-project postings may require additional ledgers. Verify whether secondary cost elements or ledger groups are suppressing FI.

So the troubleshooting steps would be

  • Post identical 344 Q transfers in a non-productive client. Compare accounting output. Turn on ST05 SQL trace for user and transaction MIGO, filter on tables MSEG, BSEG. See if the FI insert ever fires.
  • Pull two material documents (one with FI, one without). Compare the Document Header (MKPF), Accounting Document Link fields, and whether a commit happened after FI.
  • In OMWA check that movement type 344 Q uses the correct transaction key for account determination. Run OBYC checks for keys: BSX, WRX, PRD, VBR.
  • Confirm users have rights for both MM and FI postings. A missing FI authorization can post materials only.

entry.title: Re: How to prevent billing plan value greater than sales...
entry.content:
Ok so in that case, you can use BAdI C_SALESORDER_MANAGE_CHECK which fires just before the order is committed. Inside your BAdI implementation you will:

  • Read each sales‐order item’s billing plan via the standard OData API or class (e.g. CL_SALESORDER_BILLINGPLAN=>GET_PLAN)
  • Sum up all billing‐plan values
  • Compare to the item’s net value (ITM_NET_VALUE)
  • If the billing plan total > net value, call the BAdI’s error and prevents the order from saving.

entry.title: Goods receipt to special stock type E for the cross-company code returns process.
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

We are currently implementing the cross-company sales process and have set up the corresponding returns process in accordance with Scope Item 2F4. During testing, we observed that when posting the goods receipt for a return, the system does not assign Special Stock Type "E" (Orders on Hand), but instead posts the stock to Blocked Stock without any Special Stock Type.

This issue seems restricted to the context of cross-company returns. For example, if both sales organization and return plant are under the same company code, the Special Stock “E” assignment works correctly.

We have confirmed that our item category, schedule line category, movement type (657), and plant configuration are correctly maintained. However, the expected special stock behavior is missing only for cross-company returns.

Can you please clarify:

  • Is this standard system behavior in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
  • If yes, what is the recommendation for tracking returned stock by sales order in such scenarios?
  • Are there workarounds or extensibility options available?

Thank you in advance.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Goods receipt to special stock type E for the cross-c...
entry.content:
This is expected system behavior in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, particularly under Scope Item 2F4 (Cross-Company Returns).

In cross-company returns, SAP does not support Special Stock Type “E” (Sales Order Stock). This is because:

  • The return plant and the original selling company code are different legal entities
  • As such, stock cannot be tied to a specific sales order for valuation and legal reasons
  • Therefore, the system posts the returned goods into Blocked Stock without assigning Special Stock Type "E"

This behavior is also documented in SAP Help for scope item 2F4:

“Cross-company returns do not support sales order stock tracking.”

Workarounds

  1. Use plants within the same company code for return flows where Special Stock Type “E” is needed
  2. If available in your project scope, build custom logic to store the sales order reference in a custom field during return posting, allowing traceability without native Special Stock handling would require consulting 2706322 - What is Support – What is Consulting: Cloud Solutions
  3. Submit a feature request to SAP via the Influence Portal: 2963059 - How to Submit Feature Requests for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Re: 【solved 】An error occurred while installing SAP S/4HA...
entry.content:
My Solution:

Before registering HANA, uninstall lss.

Uninstall lss

# cd /lss/shared/HDB/install

# ./hdbuninst

 

Register HANA

# /hana/shared/HDB/hdblcm/hdblcm --action=register_rename_system

Cancel registration if attempt to start lss is unsuccessful

 

Reinstall lss from Server install file "IMDB_SERVER20_082_0-80002031.SAR"

First extract Files with hdblcm

# /hana/shared/HDB/hdblcm/hdblcm

6 - extract_components

 

Delete old lss folder (I think that's optional)

# rm -r /lss

# rm -r /lss_home/

# cd /hana/shared/HDB/

# unlink lss

 

Reinstall lss

# /hana/shared/HDB/hdblcm/hdblcm

13 - update

 

Rename HANA

# /hana/shared/HDB/hdblcm/hdblcm

entry.title: Re: Cummulative business volume for scale basis-Settlemen...
entry.content:
Settlement Management in SAP S/4HANA 2023 provides a unified framework to manage royalties agreements and calculate accruals and settlements based on defined business volumes. By defining one business volume for cumulative billing (to pick the rate) and a second period-related volume for the actual posting base, you can drive monthly accruals and quarterly settlements with just standard customizing.

First, you have to define two Business Volume Types. So go to SPRO → Sales and Distribution → Settlement Management → Basic Settings → Business Volume → Define Business Volume Types. There

  • Create ZCUM (Cumulative Billing Value): leave as period-independent
  • Create ZMON (Monthly Billing Value): flag as Period-related so that you can post only each month’s delta

Next, Configure Business Volume Controls and for that, go to SPRO → Sales and Distribution → Settlement Management → Basic Settings → Business Volume → Define Business Volume Controls

  • For ZMON, enable “Difference from Last Period” to derive only the month’s billing value
  • Leave ZCUM as an absolute cumulative total (used solely for tier/rate lookup)

Then, assign Business Volumes in Your Contract & Conditions and for that, go to SPRO → Settlement Management → Basic Settings → Contract → Condition Contract Types, map ZCUM and ZMON as the two business-volume fields on your royalty contract type.

Create two custom condition types:

  • ZYR_ACCR (Monthly Accrual), Business Volume = ZMON, Scale Basis = ZCUM
  • ZYR_SETT (Quarterly Settlement), Business Volume = ZMON, Scale Basis = ZCUM

Copy standard procedure BSETTL → ZBSTTL. In ZBSTTL, insert ZYR_ACCR and ZYR_SETT into the sequence. For each condition type, choose the appropriate base-value formula 214 or 216, so that ZMON is picked up correctly

Monthly Accrual Run: System reads ZMON (period delta) and applies the rate fetched from ZCUM to calculate your royalties accrual for that month.
Quarterly Partial Settlement: System again uses ZMON with its “difference from last period” logic to pick up only the last three months’ billing—and looks at the updated ZCUM to derive the rate for that quarter.

entry.title: Re: Subcontracting process - Two freight costs
entry.content:
When you’ve already done MIRO against the subcontracting PO (category L) and can’t reverse it, the easiest supported way to pick up extra inbound freight—and have it flow into your repaired‐material valuation at GR—is to use MIRO’s “Planned Delivery Cost” option. SAP will post a separate freight line on the invoice, then automatically apportion all freight (both original and new) into inventory when you do the GR of the repaired material.

Your FRB1 must be defined as actual freight in the PO (not provisional) and flagged for inventory valuation (in condition‐type customizing). OBYC must have the proper G/L for freight → inventory, so that freight lines capitalize into stock. When you later do the GR (movement 543 for return of repaired material), SAP:

  • Picks up all posted planned‐delivery‐cost entries
  • Apportions them proportionally into the material’s moving‐average price
  • Posts the final inventory value with both freight components included

If you want a “cleaner” audit trail, you can treat the extra freight as a subsequent debit, Create a new MIRO with Subsequent Debit/Credit indicator (still reference the same PO). Enter the freight G/L and amount manually and post it. This hits a freight‐liability account and posts to freight expense, but it won’t automatically capitalize into inventory—so you’d need a separate adjustment (MR11 or manual journal) at GR time.
